Content-Range.description: Indicates the range of bytes returned in the event that the client requested a subset of the blob by setting the 'Range' request header.

Content-MD5.description: If the blob has an MD5 hash and this operation is to read the full blob, this response header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

Content-Encoding.description: This header returns the value that was specified for the Content-Encoding request header

Cache-Control.description: This header is returned if it was previously specified for the blob.

Content-Disposition.description: This header returns the value that was specified for the 'x-ms-blob-content-disposition' header. The Content-Disposition response header field conveys additional information about how to process the response payload, and also can be used to attach additional metadata. For example, if set to attachment, it indicates that the user-agent should not display the response, but instead show a Save As dialog with a filename other than the blob name specified.

Content-Language.description: This header returns the value that was specified for the Content-Language request header.

x-ms-copy-completion-time.description: Conclusion time of the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This value can specify the time of a completed, aborted, or failed copy attempt. This header does not appear if a copy is pending, if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

x-ms-copy-status-description.description: Only appears when x-ms-copy-status is failed or pending. Describes the cause of the last fatal or non-fatal copy operation failure. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

x-ms-copy-id.description: String identifier for this copy operation. Use with Get Blob Properties to check the status of this copy operation, or pass to Abort Copy Blob to abort a pending copy.

x-ms-copy-progress.description: Contains the number of bytes copied and the total bytes in the source in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. Can show between 0 and Content-Length bytes copied. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

x-ms-copy-status.description: State of the copy operation identified by x-ms-copy-id.

x-ms-copy-source.description: URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies the source blob or file used in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

delete.description: If the storage account's soft delete feature is disabled then, when a blob is deleted, it is permanently removed from the storage account. If the storage account's soft delete feature is enabled, then, when a blob is deleted, it is marked for deletion and becomes inaccessible immediately. However, the blob service retains the blob or snapshot for the number of days specified by the DeleteRetentionPolicy section of [Storage service properties] (Set-Blob-Service-Properties.md). After the specified number of days has passed, the blob's data is permanently removed from the storage account. Note that you continue to be charged for the soft-deleted blob's storage until it is permanently removed. Use the List Blobs API and specify the \"include=deleted\" query parameter to discover which blobs and snapshots have been soft deleted. You can then use the Undelete Blob API to restore a soft-deleted blob. All other operations on a soft-deleted blob or snapshot causes the service to return an HTTP status code of 404 (ResourceNotFound).

put.description: The Upload Block Blob operation updates the content of an existing block blob. Updating an existing block blob overwrites any existing metadata on the blob. Partial updates are not supported with Put Blob; the content of the existing blob is overwritten with the content of the new blob. To perform a partial update of the content of a block blob, use the Put Block List operation.

put.description: The Commit Block List operation writes a blob by specifying the list of block IDs that make up the blob. In order to be written as part of a blob, a block must have been successfully written to the server in a prior Put Block operation. You can call Put Block List to update a blob by uploading only those blocks that have changed, then committing the new and existing blocks together. You can do this by specifying whether to commit a block from the committed block list or from the uncommitted block list, or to commit the most recently uploaded version of the block, whichever list it may belong to.

put.description: The Copy Incremental operation copies a snapshot of the source page blob to a destination page blob. The snapshot is copied such that only the differential changes between the previously copied snapshot are transferred to the destination. The copied snapshots are complete copies of the original snapshot and can be read or copied from as usual. This API is supported since REST version 2016-05-31.

x-ms-copy-completion-time.description: Conclusion time of the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This value can specify the time of a completed, aborted, or failed copy attempt. This header does not appear if a copy is pending, if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

x-ms-copy-status-description.description: Only appears when x-ms-copy-status is failed or pending. Describes the cause of the last fatal or non-fatal copy operation failure. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

x-ms-copy-id.description: String identifier for this copy operation. Use with Get Blob Properties to check the status of this copy operation, or pass to Abort Copy Blob to abort a pending copy.

x-ms-copy-progress.description: Contains the number of bytes copied and the total bytes in the source in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. Can show between 0 and Content-Length bytes copied. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

x-ms-copy-source.description: URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies the source blob or file used in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

x-ms-copy-status.description: State of the copy operation identified by x-ms-copy-id.

x-ms-lease-duration.description: When a blob is leased, specifies whether the lease is of infinite or fixed duration.

This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

x-ms-copy-source.description: URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies the source blob or file used in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

x-ms-copy-status.description: State of the copy operation identified by x-ms-copy-id.

x-ms-encryption-scope.description: If the blob has a MD5 hash, and if request contains range header (Range or x-ms-range), this response header is returned with the value of the whole blob's MD5 value. This value may or may not be equal to the value returned in Content-MD5 header, with the latter calculated from the requested range

x-ms-blob-content-md5.description: If the blob has a MD5 hash, and if request contains range header (Range or x-ms-range), this response header is returned with the value of the whole blob's MD5 value. This value may or may not be equal to the value returned in Content-MD5 header, with the latter calculated from the requested range

AccessTierOptionalParameter.name: x-ms-access-tier
AccessTierOptionalParameter.description: Optional.  The tier to be set on the blob.

AccessTierRequiredParameter.name: x-ms-access-tier
AccessTierRequiredParameter.description: Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.

ApiVersionParameter.name: x-ms-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

BlobCacheControlParameter.name: x-ms-blob-cache-control
BlobCacheControlParameter.description: Optional. Sets the blob's cache control. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

BlobConditionAppendPosParameter.name: x-ms-blob-condition-appendpos
BlobConditionAppendPosParameter.description: Optional conditional header, used only for the Append Block operation. A number indicating the byte offset to compare. Append Block will succeed only if the append position is equal to this number. If it is not, the request will fail with the AppendPositionConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 - Precondition Failed).

BlobConditionMaxSizeParameter.name: x-ms-blob-condition-maxsize
BlobConditionMaxSizeParameter.description: Optional conditional header. The max length in bytes permitted for the append blob. If the Append Block operation would cause the blob to exceed that limit or if the blob size is already greater than the value specified in this header, the request will fail with MaxBlobSizeConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 - Precondition Failed).

BlobContentDispositionParameter.name: x-ms-blob-content-disposition
BlobContentDispositionParameter.description: Optional. Sets the blob's content disposition. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

BlobContentEncodingParameter.name: x-ms-blob-content-encoding
BlobContentEncodingParameter.description: Optional. Sets the blob's content encoding. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

BlobContentLanguageParameter.name: x-ms-blob-content-language
BlobContentLanguageParameter.description: Optional. Set the blob's content language. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

BlobContentLengthRequiredParameter.name: x-ms-blob-content-length
BlobContentLengthRequiredParameter.description: This header specifies the maximum size for the page blob, up to 1 TB. The page blob size must be aligned to a 512-byte boundary.

BlobContentMd5Parameter.name: x-ms-blob-content-md5
BlobContentMd5Parameter.description: Optional. An MD5 hash of the blob content. Note that this hash is not validated, as the hashes for the individual blocks were validated when each was uploaded.

BlobContentTypeParameter.name: x-ms-blob-content-type
BlobContentTypeParameter.description: Optional. Sets the blob's content type. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

BlobDeleteTypeParameter.name: deletetype
BlobDeleteTypeParameter.description: Optional.  Only possible value is 'permanent', which specifies to permanently delete a blob if blob soft delete is enabled.

values.name: none
values.description: The delete snapshots include option is not specified.

values.name: include
values.description: The delete snapshots include option is include.

BlobExpiryOptionsParameter.name: x-ms-expiry-option
BlobExpiryOptionsParameter.description: Required. Indicates mode of the expiry time

BlobExpiryTimeParameter.name: x-ms-expiry-time
BlobExpiryTimeParameter.description: The time to set the blob to expiry.

BlobPublicAccessParameter.name: x-ms-blob-public-access
BlobPublicAccessParameter.description: Specifies whether data in the container may be accessed publicly and the level of access. Possible values include: 'container', 'blob'.

BlobSequenceNumberParameter.name: x-ms-blob-sequence-number
BlobSequenceNumberParameter.description: Optional.  The sequence number is a user-controlled property that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 2^63 - 1. The default value is 0.

BlobTagsHeaderParameter.name: x-ms-tags
BlobTagsHeaderParameter.description: Optional.  Used to set blob tags in various blob operations.

BlockIdParameter.name: blockid
BlockIdParameter.description: A valid Base64 string value that identifies the block. Prior to encoding, the string must be less than or equal to 64 bytes in size. For a given blob, the length of the value specified for the blockid parameter must be the same size for each block.

BlockListTypeParameter.name: blocklisttype
BlockListTypeParameter.description: Specifies whether to return the list of committed blocks, the list of uncommitted blocks, or both lists together.

ClientRequestIdParameter.name: x-ms-client-request-id
ClientRequestIdParameter.description: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

ContainerAclParameter.name: acl
ContainerAclParameter.description: The access control list for the container.

ContentCrc64Parameter.name: x-ms-content-crc64
ContentCrc64Parameter.description: Specify the transactional crc64 for the body, to be validated by the service.

ContentMd5Parameter.name: Content-MD5
ContentMd5Parameter.description: Optional. An MD5 hash of the blob content. Note that this hash is not validated, as the hashes for the individual blocks were validated when each was uploaded.

CopyIdParameter.name: x-ms-copy-id
CopyIdParameter.description: The copy identifier provided in the x-ms-copy-id header of the original Copy Blob operation.

CopySourceAuthorizationParameter.name: x-ms-copy-source-authorization
CopySourceAuthorizationParameter.description: Only Bearer type is supported. Credentials should be a valid OAuth access token to copy source.

CopySourceBlobPropertiesParameter.name: x-ms-copy-source-blob-properties
CopySourceBlobPropertiesParameter.description: Optional, default is true.  Indicates if properties from the source blob should be copied.

CopySourceParameter.name: x-ms-copy-source
CopySourceParameter.description: Specifies the name of the source page blob snapshot. This value is a URL of up to 2 KB in length that specifies a page blob snapshot. The value should be URL-encoded as it would appear in a request URI. The source blob must either be public or must be authenticated via a shared access signature.

CopySourceTagsParameter.name: x-ms-copy-source-tags
CopySourceTagsParameter.description: Optional, default 'replace'.  Indicates if source tags should be copied or replaced with the tags specified by x-ms-tags.

DefaultEncryptionScopeParameter.name: x-ms-default-encryption-scope
DefaultEncryptionScopeParameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-07-07 and later.  Specifies the default encryption scope to set on the container and use for all future writes.

DeleteSnapshotsParameter.name: x-ms-delete-snapshots
DeleteSnapshotsParameter.description: Required if the blob has associated snapshots. Specify one of the following two options: include: Delete the base blob and all of its snapshots. only: Delete only the blob's snapshots and not the blob itself

values.name: none
values.description: The delete snapshots include option is not specified.

values.name: include
values.description: The delete snapshots include option is include.

DeletedContainerNameParameter.name: x-ms-deleted-container-name
DeletedContainerNameParameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-12-12 and later.  Specifies the name of the deleted container to restore.

DeletedContainerVersionParameter.name: x-ms-deleted-container-version
DeletedContainerVersionParameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-12-12 and later.  Specifies the version of the deleted container to restore.

DelimiterParameter.name: delimiter
DelimiterParameter.description: When the request includes this parameter, the operation returns a BlobPrefix element in the response body that acts as a placeholder for all blobs whose names begin with the same substring up to the appearance of the delimiter character. The delimiter may be a single character or a string.

DenyEncryptionScopeOverrideParameter.name: x-ms-deny-encryption-scope-override
DenyEncryptionScopeOverrideParameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-07-07 and later.  Specifies that the request will fail if the target container does not have the same encryption scope as the source container.

EncryptionAlgorithmParameter.name: x-ms-encryption-algorithm
EncryptionAlgorithmParameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-07-07 and later.  Specifies the algorithm to use for encryption. If not specified, the default is AES256.

EncryptionKeyParameter.name: x-ms-encryption-key
EncryptionKeyParameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-07-07 and later.  Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, the request will be encrypted with the root account key.

EncryptionKeySha256Parameter.name: x-ms-encryption-key-sha256
EncryptionKeySha256Parameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-07-07 and later.  Specifies the SHA256 hash of the encryption key used to encrypt the data provided in the request. This header is only used for encryption with a customer-provided key. If the request is authenticated with a client token, this header should be specified using the SHA256 hash of the encryption key.

EncryptionScopeParameter.name: x-ms-encryption-scope
EncryptionScopeParameter.description: Optional.  Version 2019-07-07 and later.  Specifies the encryption scope to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, the request will be encrypted with the root account key.

FilterBlobsInclude.name: include
FilterBlobsInclude.description: Include this parameter to specify one or more datasets to include in the response.

FilterBlobsWhere.name: where
FilterBlobsWhere.description: Filters the results to return only to return only blobs whose tags match the specified expression.

GetRangeContentCrc64Parameter.name: x-ms-range-get-content-crc64
GetRangeContentCrc64Parameter.description: Optional.  When this header is set to true and specified together with the Range header, the service returns the CRC64 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.

GetRangeContentMd5Parameter.name: x-ms-range-get-content-md5
GetRangeContentMd5Parameter.description: Optional.  When this header is set to true and specified together with the Range header, the service returns the MD5 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.

IfMatchParameter.name: If-Match
IfMatchParameter.description: A condition that must be met in order for the request to be processed.

IfModifiedSinceParameter.name: If-Modified-Since
IfModifiedSinceParameter.description: A date-time value. A request is made under the condition that the resource has been modified since the specified date-time.

IfNoneMatchParameter.name: If-None-Match
IfNoneMatchParameter.description: A condition that must be met in order for the request to be processed.

IfSequenceNumberEqualToParameter.name: x-ms-if-sequence-number-eq
IfSequenceNumberEqualToParameter.description: Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has the specified sequence number.

IfSequenceNumberLessThanOrEqualToParamet.name: x-ms-if-sequence-number-le
IfSequenceNumberLessThanOrEqualToParamet.description: Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has a sequence number less than or equal to the specified.

IfSequenceNumberLessThanParameter.name: x-ms-if-sequence-number-lt
IfSequenceNumberLessThanParameter.description: Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has a sequence number less than the specified.

IfTagsParameter.name: x-ms-if-tags
IfTagsParameter.description: Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.

IfUnmodifiedSinceParameter.name: If-Unmodified-Since
IfUnmodifiedSinceParameter.description: A date-time value. A request is made under the condition that the resource has not been modified since the specified date-time.

ImmutabilityPolicyExpiryParameter.name: x-ms-immutability-policy-until-date
ImmutabilityPolicyExpiryParameter.description: Specifies the date time when the blobs immutability policy is set to expire.

ImmutabilityPolicyModeParameter.name: x-ms-immutability-policy-mode
ImmutabilityPolicyModeParameter.description: Specifies the immutability policy mode to set on the blob.

LeaseBreakPeriodParameter.name: x-ms-lease-break-period
LeaseBreakPeriodParameter.description: For a break operation, proposed duration the lease should continue before it is broken, in seconds, between 0 and 60. This break period is only used if it is shorter than the time remaining on the lease. If longer, the time remaining on the lease is used. A new lease will not be available before the break period has expired, but the lease may be held for longer than the break period. If this header does not appear with a break operation, a fixed-duration lease breaks after the remaining lease period elapses, and an infinite lease breaks immediately.

LeaseDurationParameter.name: x-ms-lease-duration
LeaseDurationParameter.description: Specifies the duration of the lease, in seconds, or negative one (-1) for a lease that never expires. A non-infinite lease can be between 15 and 60 seconds. A lease duration cannot be changed using renew or change.

LeaseIdOptionalParameter.name: x-ms-lease-id
LeaseIdOptionalParameter.description: If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.

LeaseIdRequired.name: x-ms-lease-id
LeaseIdRequired.description: Required.  A lease ID for the source path. If specified, the source path must have an active lease and the lease ID must match.

LeaseIdRequiredParameter.name: x-ms-lease-id
LeaseIdRequiredParameter.description: Required.  A lease ID for the source path. If specified, the source path must have an active lease and the lease ID must match.

LegalHoldOptionalParameter.name: x-ms-legal-hold
LegalHoldOptionalParameter.description: Specified if a legal hold should be set on the blob.

LegalHoldRequiredParameter.name: x-ms-legal-hold
LegalHoldRequiredParameter.description: Required.  Specifies the legal hold status to set on the blob.

ListBlobsInclude.name: include
ListBlobsInclude.description: Include this parameter to specify one or more datasets to include in the response.

MarkerParameter.name: marker
MarkerParameter.description: A string value that identifies the portion of the list of containers to be returned with the next listing operation. The operation returns the NextMarker value within the response body if the listing operation did not return all containers remaining to be listed with the current page. The NextMarker value can be used as the value for the marker parameter in a subsequent call to request the next page of list items. The marker value is opaque to the client.

MaxResultsParameter.name: maxresults
MaxResultsParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of containers to return. If the request does not specify maxresults, or specifies a value greater than 5000, the server will return up to 5000 items.

PrefixParameter.name: prefix
PrefixParameter.description: Filters the results to return only containers whose name begins with the specified prefix.

PremiumPageBlobAccessTierOptional.name: x-ms-access-tier
PremiumPageBlobAccessTierOptional.description: Optional. Indicates the tier to be set on the page blob.

values.name: P4
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P4.

values.name: P6
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P6.

values.name: P10
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P10.

values.name: P15
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P15.

values.name: P20
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P20.

values.name: P30
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P30.

values.name: P40
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P40.

values.name: P50
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P50.

values.name: P60
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P60.

values.name: P70
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P70.

values.name: P80
values.description: The premium page blob access tier is P80.

PrevSnapshotParameter.name: prevsnapshot
PrevSnapshotParameter.description: Optional in version 2015-07-08 and newer. The prevsnapshot parameter is a DateTime value that specifies that the response will contain only pages that were changed between target blob and previous snapshot. Changed pages include both updated and cleared pages. The target blob may be a snapshot, as long as the snapshot specified by prevsnapshot is the older of the two. Note that incremental snapshots are currently supported only for blobs created on or after January 1, 2016.

PrevSnapshotUrlParameter.name: x-ms-previous-snapshot-url
PrevSnapshotUrlParameter.description: Optional. This header is only supported in service versions 2019-04-19 and after and specifies the URL of a previous snapshot of the target blob. The response will only contain pages that were changed between the target blob and its previous snapshot.

ProposedLeaseIdOptional.name: x-ms-proposed-lease-id
ProposedLeaseIdOptional.description: Optional.  The proposed lease ID for the container.

ProposedLeaseIdRequired.name: x-ms-proposed-lease-id
ProposedLeaseIdRequired.description: Required.  The proposed lease ID for the container.

RangeParameter.name: x-ms-range
RangeParameter.description: Return only the bytes of the blob in the specified range.

RangeRequiredPutPageFromUrlParameter.name: x-ms-range
RangeRequiredPutPageFromUrlParameter.description: Bytes of source data in the specified range. The length of this range should match the ContentLength header and x-ms-range/Range destination range header.

RehydratePriorityParameter.name: x-ms-rehydrate-priority
RehydratePriorityParameter.description: Optional: Indicates the priority with which to rehydrate an archived blob.

SealBlobParameter.name: x-ms-seal-blob
SealBlobParameter.description: Overrides the sealed state of the destination blob.  Service version 2019-12-12 and newer.

SequenceNumberActionParameter.name: x-ms-sequence-number-action
SequenceNumberActionParameter.description: Required if the x-ms-blob-sequence-number header is set for the request. This property applies to page blobs only. This property indicates how the service should modify the blob's sequence number

values.name: max
values.description: Set the maximum for the sequence number.

SequenceNumberParameter.name: x-ms-blob-sequence-number
SequenceNumberParameter.description: Set for page blobs only. The sequence number is a user-controlled value that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 2^63 - 1.

SnapshotParameter.name: snapshot
SnapshotParameter.description: The snapshot parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the blob snapshot to retrieve. For more information on working with blob snapshots, see Creating a Snapshot of a Blob.

SourceContainerNameParameter.name: x-ms-source-container-name
SourceContainerNameParameter.description: Required.  Specifies the name of the container to rename.

SourceContentCrc64Parameter.name: x-ms-source-content-crc64
SourceContentCrc64Parameter.description: Specify the crc64 calculated for the range of bytes that must be read from the copy source.

SourceContentMd5Parameter.name: x-ms-source-content-md5
SourceContentMd5Parameter.description: Specify the md5 calculated for the range of bytes that must be read from the copy source.

SourceIfMatchParameter.name: x-ms-source-if-match
SourceIfMatchParameter.description: Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.

SourceIfModifiedSinceParameter.name: x-ms-source-if-modified-since
SourceIfModifiedSinceParameter.description: Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.

SourceIfNoneMatchParameter.name: x-ms-source-if-none-match
SourceIfNoneMatchParameter.description: Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.

SourceIfTagsParameter.name: x-ms-source-if-tags
SourceIfTagsParameter.description: Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.

SourceIfUnmodifiedSinceParameter.name: x-ms-source-if-unmodified-since
SourceIfUnmodifiedSinceParameter.description: Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.

SourceLeaseIdParameter.name: x-ms-source-lease-id
SourceLeaseIdParameter.description: A lease ID for the source path. If specified, the source path must have an active lease and the lease ID must match.

SourceRangeParameter.name: x-ms-source-range
SourceRangeParameter.description: Bytes of source data in the specified range.

SourceRangeRequiredPutPageFromUrlParamet.name: x-ms-source-range
SourceRangeRequiredPutPageFromUrlParamet.description: Bytes of source data in the specified range. The length of this range should match the ContentLength header and x-ms-range/Range destination range header.

SourceUrlParameter.name: x-ms-source-url
SourceUrlParameter.description: Specify a URL to the copy source.

TimeoutParameter.name: timeout
TimeoutParameter.description: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations.

VersionIdParameter.name: versionid
VersionIdParameter.description: The version id parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the version of the blob to operate on. It's for service version 2019-10-10 and newer.
